metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3099 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use After Free in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0360.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm12').
